description: Refurbishment and improvement works to interior and exterior of property to include removal of modern cladding panels in order to repair and refurbish existing timber structural framework and other associated internal and external repairs

constraints_details.constraints_layer_description: KTCAAP Name: Kingston Town Centre AAP
KEYACH Name: Kingston Town Centre Key Area of Change
CONARA Name: Kingston Old Town Conservation Area
KEYACO Name: Kingston Old Town Conservation Area
AIRCZ Type:: Gatwick Airport Wind Turbine Consultation Zone:Contact: The Safeguarding Department, Gatwick Airport Limited, 7th Floor Destinations Place, London Gatwick Airport, West Sussex, RH06 0NP

AIRCZ Type:: Heathrow Planning Consultation Zone: All buildings, structures, erections and works exceeding 90 metres in height (295.3 feet)Contact: The Safeguarding Department, Heathrow Airport Limited, c/o Planning Services, First Point, Buckingham Gate, Gatwick Airport, West Sussex, RH6 0NT
LBCASE LB Address: 37-41HIGH STREET(east side)LB Grade: GD2SLB Ref: 8A/2

decision_conditions: Prior to commencement of the hereby approved works, the applicant shall submit a written and photographic document of all of the existing infill panel materials, so issues and impacts of proposals can be accurately understood. The document shall also detail the staged process of any removal of historic fabric in conjunction with the proposed repairs. The approved works shall be implemented in accordance with the approved written and photographic document and staged plan of works.Reason: In order that the special architectural and historic character of the Listed Building is safeguarded in accordance with Policies CS8 (Character, Heritage and Design), DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) and DM12 (Development in Conservation Areas and Affecting Heritage Assets) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

Any proposed repairs to sole plates must use air-dried timber, on a bed of lime mortar atop a brick plinth if required. Further information on the proposed repairs, including a detailed method statement for the repair or replacement of the soleplate will be submitted to the local planning authority for approval prior to commencement of works.Reason: In order that the special architectural and historic character of the Listed Building is safeguarded in accordance with Policies CS8 (Character, Heritage and Design), DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) and DM12 (Development in Conservation Areas and Affecting Heritage Assets) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

Any damage to the building caused by or during the course of the carrying out of the works permitted shall be made good within 3 months of the completion of the development, in accordance with a specification agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority.Reason: In order that the special architectural and historic character of the Listed Building is safeguarded in accordance with Policies CS8 (Character, Heritage and Design), DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) and DM12 (Development in Conservation Areas and Affecting Heritage Assets) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

The works hereby permitted shall begin before the expiration of three years from the date of this consent. Reason: This is required by Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

Prior to commencement details and method statement(s) shall be submitted and approved in writing by the local planning authority of any required splicing with appropriate new timber, employing 'scarf' joints. A detailed survey drawing recording the timber elements, their condition and significance and any required repairs will also be submitted to the local planning authority for approval which records any loss or alteration of fabric.Reason: In order that the special architectural and historic character of the Listed Building is safeguarded in accordance with Policies CS8 (Character, Heritage and Design), DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) and DM12 (Development in Conservation Areas and Affecting Heritage Assets) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.
